overview: Present-day Venice. Far from the swarms of tourists and cruise ships an alternate topography is made plainâ€” one lived at the edges of the ancient city's lagoons, beneath the surface of its canals. A shipwright, a Venetian rowing champion, a diver, a fish merchant and a fisherman chronicle their daily lives as proximate and dependent on water, the founding element of the Venetian Republic a thousand years prior.
title: In Aquis Fundata
